synthesized_claims.statement: Valproic acid (VPA) directly modulates VDAC1, promoting an open state that contributes to its mitochondrial toxicity.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: VPA, a fatty acid anion present at high therapeutic concentrations (300-700 µM), electrostatically and hydrophobically interacts with VDAC1, stabilizing its high-conductance state.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: A reconstituted VDAC1 lipid bilayer system showing no change in channel open probability or conductance in the presence of 500 µM VPA.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Valproic acid (VPA) directly modulates VDAC1, promoting an open state that contributes to its mitochondrial toxicity.

synthesized_claims.statement: NAPQI interacts with VDAC1 via covalent modification of exposed cysteine residue(s) (Cys127, Cys232), contributing to mitochondrial permeability transition during acetaminophen toxicity.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: NAPQI is a potent electrophile that modifies protein thiols; VDAC1 has solvent-accessible cysteines in the channel wall; thiol modification is known to shift VDAC gating to closed state.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Mass spectrometry of VDAC from APAP-treated hepatocyte mitochondria showing no NAPQI adducts on VDAC cysteines.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: NAPQI interacts with VDAC1 via covalent modification of exposed cysteine residue(s) (Cys127, Cys232), contributing to mitochondrial permeability transition during acetaminophen toxicity.

synthesized_claims.statement: Lipophilic statins (e.g., atorvastatin) are low-affinity VDAC modulators, and their accumulation in the outer mitochondrial membrane is a key initiating factor in statin-associated myopathy.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: High local concentrations of the statin in the outer membrane allosterically constrain VDAC's conformation, impairing metabolite flux and triggering downstream mitochondrial stress pathways.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Muscle-specific VDAC1 knockout mice showing complete resistance to statin-induced myopathy despite similar statin accumulation in muscle tissue.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Lipophilic statins (e.g., atorvastatin) are low-affinity VDAC modulators, and their accumulation in the outer mitochondrial membrane is a key initiating factor in statin-associated myopathy.

synthesized_claims.statement: Metformin at mitochondrial matrix concentrations (estimated 1–10 mM due to membrane-potential-driven accumulation) likely modulates VDAC gating from the intermembrane space side, but published direct binding data are absent.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Metformin is a cationic biguanide that accumulates ~1000× in mitochondria; VDAC voltage-sensing is charge-sensitive; high local concentrations could alter channel selectivity.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: Planar bilayer recordings with metformin titration showing no effect on VDAC conductance up to 10 mM.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Metformin at mitochondrial matrix concentrations (estimated 1–10 mM due to membrane-potential-driven accumulation) likely modulates VDAC gating from the intermembrane space side, but published direct binding data are absent.

synthesized_claims.statement: The top 20 mitochondrial-acting drugs’ VDAC interaction likelihood correlates with logP > 3 and pKa < 7.4 (anionic at cytosolic pH).
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Drugs with high logP partition into mitochondrial membranes, increasing VDAC1 encounter probability; anionic charge favors binding to VDAC1’s cationic N-terminus.
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: A screen of 20 drugs finds no correlation between logP/pKa and VDAC1 binding affinity. --- ───
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: The top 20 mitochondrial-acting drugs’ VDAC interaction likelihood correlates with logP > 3 and pKa < 7.4 (anionic at cytosolic pH).

synthesized_claims.statement: Metformin does not directly engage VDAC1 gating at therapeutic mito concentrations (>>100μM).
synthesized_claims.mechanism: Metformin's polypharmacy on Complex I/ANT lacks structural mimicry to VDAC1 ligands (e.g., no amphipathicity for MOM partition).
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: SPR/BLI assay showing metformin Kd <500μM on VDAC1 protein.
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Metformin does not directly engage VDAC1 gating at therapeutic mito concentrations (>>100μM).

synthesized_claims.statement: Among top 20 mito drugs (metformin, atorva, aspirin, omeprazole), predicted VDAC1 interactors at C_eff/TI: VPA >>> aspirin > simvastatin > naproxen; metformin/levothyroxine negligible.
synthesized_claims.mechanism: QSAR: logP>3 + H-bond acceptors correlate with VDAC1 β-sheet binding (CBD analog).
synthesized_claims.falsifiable_by: CETSA shift assay on VDAC1 thermal stability by top 5 candidates. ───
synthesized_claims.chunk_text: Among top 20 mito drugs (metformin, atorva, aspirin, omeprazole), predicted VDAC1 interactors at C_eff/TI: VPA >>> aspirin > simvastatin > naproxen; metformin/levothyroxine negligible.
